description.content: Manage configurations
Retrieves a single configuration of the checkout process for the store.
(Required) Checkout configuration ID.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Creates a new checkout configuration for the store. This endpoint allows stores to define and set up a custom checkout configuration to their specific requirements.
(Required) Checkout configuration ID.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

Updates an existing checkout configuration for the store. This endpoint enables clients to modify and refine the settings of an existing checkout configuration according to evolving business needs or changing requirements.
(Required) Checkout configuration ID.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)

(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Deletes an existing checkout configuration for the store. This endpoint allows clients to remove a checkout configuration that is no longer needed or has become obsolete.
(Required) Checkout configuration ID.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)
(Required) Type of the content being sent.
(Required) HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. (This can only be one of vtexcommercestable)

This is a REST API responsible for managing the checkout configurations of a store. The API provides endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting checkout configurations, allowing clients to customize and optimize the checkout process according to their specific requirements.

- [`GET` - Get checkout configuration](https:\/\/developers.vtex.com\/docs\/api-reference\/#get-\/api\/checkout\/configuration\/ui)
- [`POST` - Create a new checkout configuration](https:\/\/developers.vtex.com\/docs\/api-reference\/#post-\/api\/checkout\/configuration\/ui)
- [`PUT` - Update a checkout configuration](https:\/\/developers.vtex.com\/docs\/api-reference\/#put-\/api\/checkout\/configuration\/ui)
- [`DELETE` - Delete checkout configuration](https:\/\/developers.vtex.com\/docs\/api-reference\/#delete-\/api\/checkout\/configuration\/ui)
